title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 196.11 - Examinations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 196.11 - Examinations

State Regulations
(a) All final
examinations shall be written and presented within a reasonable time after the
completion of the course work. No examination may be used unless it is approved
by the department. If a make up examination is offered, this exam must also be
submitted to the Department of State for approval. Examinations for all
approved courses must be reflective of the required course outline. (b) Examinations must be periodically
changed. (c) A mark of 70 percent
must be achieved by a student on the final examination in order for a
certificate of completion to be issued. Students who fail to achieve a mark of
at least 70 percent on the final examination may, at the discretion of the
approved entity, be allowed to take another final examination. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19
ยง
196.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
